title: Croda posts 11 percent rise in 2017 profit
text: February 27, 2018 / 7:20 AM / Updated 8 minutes ago Croda posts 11 percent rise in 2017 profit Reuters Staff 1 Min Read (Reuters) - Speciality chemicals maker Croda International Plc posted an 11.1 percent rise in full-year profit, helped by strong growth across its core businesses. Croda said adjusted pretax profit rose to 320.3 million pounds for the year ended Dec. 31, from 288.3 million pounds a year earlier. Croda, which held unsuccessful talks with U.S. peer Ashland Global Holdings Inc for a possible merger earlier this month, said sales grew by 10.4 percent to 1.37 billion pounds in 2017. Reporting By Justin George Varghese in Bengaluru; Editing by Gopakumar Warrier
